data.title: Breakfast, american traditional
data.text: This place may not be for the younger crowd but the breakfast is superb.  If you like oldschool dinner, this is your joint.  Has TV for sport viewing.

data.title: Old Style Coffee Shop
data.text:
There are very few old style coffee shops in the area, and some are not good at all.  This one has good food at a very fair price. All complete dinners under $15. I had the hamburger steak dinner. The salad was good sized with  fresh green lettuce (unusual these days, especially when the price is moderate)  The hamburger was a generous size with sides of potatoes and vegetables.  The O'Brian potatoes were very good.  The meat was moist but not very tasty, as were the vegetables.
With ketchup, not too bad.  The staff was very nice, and several "regulars" came by that Sunday evening.  Very homey.   
In a more "upscale" area, I probably would not have taken the time to review, but in this area all of good restaurants I know are either Mexican or Asian food.  Their used to be a number of really good coffee shops in the area.  It was nice to see that there is one place you can still get a decent coffee shop meal at a fair price.

data.title: Great coffee shop
data.text: I've been going to the old one for along Imelda on Las Tunas. Really like that they moved to El Monte too. Love their breakfast. El Monte need some good American style breakfast places.

data.title: Still Great !
data.text:
After decades of success in San Gabriel,Goody's is still wonderful !
Their turkey and ham sandwich remains a signature dish  and not to be missed.
French fries still wonderful !
Breakfasts also great.
We frequented the Original on Las Tunas Dr for years-starting in the 1950's.
Highly recommended !!
